text: W.C. Brown Apartment Building was a historic apartment building located at Winston-Salem, Forsyth County, North Carolina. It was built about 1941, and was a two-story brick-veneered rectangular block structure. It had a hipped roof and exposed rafter ends in the Bungalow / American Craftsman style. The building was built as rental apartments for African-American families just before World War II. The building housed workers at the nearby R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company. The building has been demolished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1998. ==References== Category:African- American history in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:Residential buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Residential buildings completed in 1941 Category:Buildings and structures in Winston-Salem, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Winston-Salem, North Carolina
title: W.C. Brown Apartment Building
